markdown.markdown:
```{r load-data, include=FALSE}
location <- paste0(getwd())
source(paste0("../00_helpers/setup.R")) #common libraries and custom functions
source(paste0("../00_helpers/species_and_phases.R"))

model_input <- readRDS(paste0(path_output_data, "/model_input.rds"))
na <- readRDS(paste0(path_output_data, "/data_na.rds"))
```

## Parameter selection

To assess the impact of environmental parameters on phenological
behavior the following observation tree parameters are available:

```{r tbl-data-overview}
#| tbl-cap: Example of the available data for sampled trees at SPN sites.

table <- model_input %>%
  slice_sample(n = 10) %>%
  mutate_if(is.numeric, signif, digits = 3) %>%
  datatable(rownames=FALSE, options = list(scrollX = TRUE, pageLength =5))
table
```

```{r fig-data-plot-unfolding, fig.cap="Time series for leaf unfolding. Grey lines represent the Q 0.05, mean and Q 0.95 day of year between 1996 and 2023."}
mean_unfolding <- model_input %>%
  filter(PHASE %like% "unfolding") %>%
  group_by(SPECIES_SHORT) %>%
  summarize(MEAN_UNFOLDING = mean(doy, na.rm = TRUE),
            LOWE_UNFOLDING = quantile(doy, 0.05, na.rm = TRUE),
            UPPE_UNFOLDING = quantile(doy, 0.95, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  mutate_if(is.numeric, round, 0)

saveRDS(mean_unfolding, paste0(path_output_data, "/mean_unfolding.rds"))

ggplot(model_input %>% filter(PHASE %like% "unfolding"), aes(x= year, y=doy, group=METEO_ID, colour=METEO_ID))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  geom_hline(data=mean_unfolding, aes(yintercept=MEAN_UNFOLDING), colour="grey")+
  geom_hline(data=mean_unfolding, aes(yintercept=LOWE_UNFOLDING), alpha = 0.2) +
  geom_hline(data=mean_unfolding, aes(yintercept=UPPE_UNFOLDING), alpha = 0.2) +
  geom_text(data=mean_unfolding, aes(x=1970, y=MEAN_UNFOLDING + 2, label=MEAN_UNFOLDING), hjust=0, vjust=0, inherit.aes = FALSE)+
  geom_text(data=mean_unfolding, aes(x=1970, y=LOWE_UNFOLDING + 2, label=LOWE_UNFOLDING), hjust=0, vjust=0, inherit.aes = FALSE)+
  geom_text(data=mean_unfolding, aes(x=1970, y=UPPE_UNFOLDING + 2, label=UPPE_UNFOLDING), hjust=0, vjust=0, inherit.aes = FALSE)+
  facet_wrap(~SPECIES_SHORT, scales = "fixed", ncol=2)+
  theme_report(legend.position = "none")
```

```{r tbl-na-overview}
#| tbl-cap: All rows and columns with na values.

for(species in species_list) {
  for(phase in phase_list){
    table <- na %>%
      filter(SPECIES_SHORT == species) %>%
      datatable(rownames=FALSE, options = list(scrollX = TRUE, pageLength = 5))
    print(table)
    }
  }
```

In total there were `r na %>% summarize(NA_COUNT = n())` NAs. The major
cause of NAs in the leaf unfolding data sets is missing leaf colouring
observations of the previous year.

## Correlations between day of year and potential explanatory variables

### Overview

All parameters except cooling and elevation have a non-linear relationship with day of year. In most cases it can be described with a quadratic / polynomial second degree term and some of the non-linear relationships e.g. Fagus sylvatica and warming are so shallow they might be fitted with a linear term. Competition parameters such as basal area or the hegyi are were not very robust due to frequent wind throws or harvesting operations in the past at many sites. Therefore, social situation was used to assess competition.

```{r pairs-functions, warning =FALSE, include=FALSE}
pair_unfold <- model_input %>% rename_fun() %>% 
  select(SPECIES_SHORT, PHASE, is.numeric, GDD_conservative, GDD_mainstream, -DOY_DATE_ROUNDED, -starts_with("stat"),
         #-DN_SUM, -DTR_SUM,
         -leaf_unfolding_50_percent) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=-c(doy, SPECIES_SHORT, PHASE), names_to = "PARAMETER", values_to="VALUE")

quickpairs_fun <- function(data, species, phase, title = NULL) {
  filtered_data <- data %>%
    filter(SPECIES_SHORT %like% species, PHASE %like% phase)
  
  if (nrow(filtered_data) > 0) {
    plot <- ggplot(data = filtered_data, aes(x = VALUE, y = doy)) +
      geom_point(shape = 1, colour = "grey", alpha = 0.5) +
      geom_smooth(colour = "#69757C", method = "loess", se = FALSE) +
      geom_smooth(aes(color = SPECIES_SHORT), method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
      species_short_color_scale() +
      facet_wrap(~PARAMETER, scales = "free", ncol = 5) +
      xlab("Explanatory variable") +
      ylab("Day of year") +
      theme_report(angle = 90,
                   border.width = 0
                   ) +
      theme(legend.position = "none")  # Hide the legend if not needed

    if (!is.null(title)) {
      plot <- plot + ggtitle(title)
    }
    
    return(plot)
  } else {
    return(NULL)  # Return NULL if no data is available
  }
}

pairs_box_fun <- function(data, species, phase, title = NULL) {
  filtered_data <- data %>%
    filter(SPECIES_SHORT %like% species, PHASE %like% phase)
  
  if (nrow(filtered_data) > 0) {
    plot <- ggplot(data = filtered_data, aes(x = VALUE, y = doy)) +
      geom_boxplot(aes(fill = SPECIES_SHORT), alpha=0.5, outlier.shape=8, outlier.size=1) +
      geom_jitter(shape = 1, colour = "#555F6A", alpha = 0.5) +
      species_short_fill_scale() +
      facet_wrap(~PARAMETER, scales = "free", ncol = 3) +
      xlab("Explanatory variable") +
      ylab("Day of year") +
      theme_report(angle = 90,
                   border.width = 0
                   ) +
      theme(legend.position = "none")

    if (!is.null(title)) {
      plot <- plot + ggtitle(title)
    }
    
    return(plot)
  } else {
    return(NULL)  # Return NULL if no data is available
  }
}

pair_box <- model_input %>%
  dplyr::select(SPECIES_SHORT, PHASE, doy, LAND_USE, OBSERVATION_TYPE, ROOT_AREA_ARTIFICIALLY_LIMITED, SOCIAL_SITUATION) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=-c(doy, SPECIES_SHORT, PHASE), names_to = "PARAMETER", values_to="VALUE")
```

```{r fig-pairs-grouped, fig.width = 10, fig.height=15}
ggplot(data = model_input %>%
         select(SPECIES_SHORT, PHASE, is.numeric, -DOY_DATE_ROUNDED, -starts_with("stat"), -leaf_unfolding_50_percent) %>%
         pivot_longer(cols=-c(doy, SPECIES_SHORT, PHASE), names_to = "PARAMETER", values_to="VALUE") %>%
         filter(PHASE %like% "unfold"),
       aes(x = VALUE, y = doy, group=SPECIES_SHORT, colour=SPECIES_SHORT)) +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = FALSE, linewidth=1) +
  facet_wrap(~PARAMETER, scales = "free", ncol = 5) +
  xlab("Explanatory variable") +
  ylab("Day of year") +
  species_short_color_scale() +
  theme_report(angle = 90, legend.position = "top")
```

### Detailed plots

#### Fagus sylvatica

```{r fig-pairs-scatter-unfolding-fs, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.width = 10, fig.height=15, fig.cap="Pairs plots of all available continuous parameters fitted with linear and loess curves for leaf unfolding of Fagus sylvativa."}
quickpairs_fun(pair_unfold, "FS", "unfo", title="Fagus sylvatica")
```

```{r fig-pairs-box-unfolding-fs, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.height=8, fig.cap="Pairs plots of selected categorical parameters for leaf unfolding of Fagus sylvativa."}
pairs_box_fun(pair_box, "FS", "unfo", title="Fagus sylvatica")
```

#### Larix decidua

```{r fig-pairs-scatter-unfolding-ld, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.width = 10, fig.height=15, fig.cap="Pairs plots of all available continuous parameters fitted with linear and loess curves for leaf unfolding of Larix decidua."}
quickpairs_fun(pair_unfold, "LD", "unfo", title="Larix decidua")
```

```{r fig-pairs-box-unfolding-ld, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.height=8, fig.cap="Pairs plots of selected categorical parameters for leaf unfolding of Larix decidua."}
pairs_box_fun(pair_box, "LD", "unfo", title="Larix decidua")
```

#### Picea abies

```{r fig-pairs-scatter-unfolding-pa, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.width = 10, fig.height=15, fig.cap="Pairs plots of all available continuous parameters fitted with linear and loess curves for leaf unfolding of Picea abies."}
quickpairs_fun(pair_unfold, "PA", "unfo", title="Picea abies")
```

```{r fig-pairs-box-unfolding-pa, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.height=8, fig.cap="Pairs plots of selected categorical parameters for leaf unfolding of Picea abies."}
pairs_box_fun(pair_box, "PA", "unfo", title="Picea abies")
```

#### Tilia cordata

```{r fig-pairs-scatter-unfolding-tc, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.width = 10, fig.height=15, fig.cap="Pairs plots of all available continuous parameters fitted with linear and loess curves for leaf unfolding of Tilia cordata."}
quickpairs_fun(pair_unfold, "TC", "unfo", title="Tilia cordata")
```

```{r fig-pairs-box-unfolding-tc, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE, fig.height=8, fig.cap="Pairs plots of selected categorical parameters for leaf unfolding of Tilia cordata."}
pairs_box_fun(pair_box, "TC", "unfo", title="Tilia cordata")
```

# Data exploration

```{r load-data, include=FALSE}
location <- paste0(getwd())
source(paste0("../00_helpers/setup.R")) #common libraries and custom functions
source(paste0("../00_helpers/species_and_phases.R"))

model_input <- readRDS(paste0(path_output_data, "/model_input.rds"))
na <- readRDS(paste0(path_output_data, "/data_na.rds"))
```

## Parameter selection

To assess the impact of environmental parameters on phenological
behavior the following observation tree parameters are available:

```{r tbl-data-overview}
#| tbl-cap: Example of the available data for sampled trees at SPN sites.

  slice_sample(n = 10) %>%
  mutate_if(is.numeric, signif, digits = 3) %>%
  datatable(rownames=FALSE, options = list(scrollX = TRUE, pageLength =5))
table
```

  filter(PHASE %like% "unfolding") %>%

            LOWE_UNFOLDING = quantile(doy, 0.05, na.rm = TRUE),
            UPPE_UNFOLDING = quantile(doy, 0.95, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  mutate_if(is.numeric, round, 0)

saveRDS(mean_unfolding, paste0(path_output_data, "/mean_unfolding.rds"))

ggplot(model_input %>% filter(PHASE %like% "unfolding"), aes(x= year, y=doy, group=METEO_ID, colour=METEO_ID))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  geom_hline(data=mean_unfolding, aes(yintercept=MEAN_UNFOLDING), colour="grey")+
  geom_hline(data=mean_unfolding, aes(yintercept=LOWE_UNFOLDING), alpha = 0.2) +
  geom_hline(data=mean_unfolding, aes(yintercept=UPPE_UNFOLDING), alpha = 0.2) +
  geom_text(data=mean_unfolding, aes(x=1970, y=MEAN_UNFOLDING + 2, label=MEAN_UNFOLDING), hjust=0, vjust=0, inherit.aes = FALSE)+
  geom_text(data=mean_unfolding, aes(x=1970, y=LOWE_UNFOLDING + 2, label=LOWE_UNFOLDING), hjust=0, vjust=0, inherit.aes = FALSE)+
  geom_text(data=mean_unfolding, aes(x=1970, y=UPPE_UNFOLDING + 2, label=UPPE_UNFOLDING), hjust=0, vjust=0, inherit.aes = FALSE)+
  facet_wrap(~SPECIES_SHORT, scales = "fixed", ncol=2)+
  theme_report(legend.position = "none")
```

```{r tbl-na-overview}
#| tbl-cap: All rows and columns with na values.

for(species in species_list) {
  for(phase in phase_list){
    table <- na %>%
      filter(SPECIES_SHORT == species) %>%
      datatable(rownames=FALSE, options = list(scrollX = TRUE, pageLength = 5))
    print(table)
    }
  }
```

In total there were `r na %>% summarize(NA_COUNT = n())` NAs. The major
cause of NAs in the leaf unfolding data sets is missing leaf colouring
observations of the previous year.

}
